paper_abstract: Answering a question of M. Talagrand, we show that there is a fixed L with the following property. For positive integers k <= n and p is an element of[0,1], if F is the set of subgraphs of K-n containing at least ((n)(k))p((2k)) copies of K-k, then there is a set G of subgraphs of K-n such that (i) each member of F contains a member of G and (ii) Sigma(S is an element of G)(p/L)(vertical bar S vertical bar) <= 1/2(where |S| means number of edges). (c) 2014 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
paper_title: Note on a problem of M. Talagrand
